name: Jessica N. Au
tagline: I decode the signatures mutagenesis leaves behind in cancer.
intro: Currently a PhD researcher in bioinformatics & systems biology at UC San Diego, building tools to understand how mutations shape disease.

paragraphs: I'm a PhD student in Bioinformatics & Systems Biology at UCSD, working in the Alexandrov Lab. My research sits at the intersection of genomics, machine learning, and data visualization.
I develop high-definition mutational signature references using 40,000+ whole-genome sequences, build AI-powered curation systems, and create interactive tools for exploring genomic data.
When I'm not analyzing mutations, I'm painting watercolors, growing jalape√±os, or tending to a succulent collection that has gotten slightly out of hand.

footer.credit: Designed & built by Jessica, with the help of Claude
footer.sub: Good science, good design, and a lot of coffee.
